name: Yellow-headed Box Turtle
description: The carapace is domed, featuring a varied yellow-orange and beige pattern.
spread_note: Eastern Asia – northern Vietnam and Hainan Island
food_note: Predominantly small animals, to a lesser extent fruits and other plant parts
reproduction: Females lay 1–3 eggs, buried under fallen leaves; incubation lasts 60–90 days.
attractions: A very shy turtle, active mainly in the morning and evening. It spends most of its time on land, hiding in undergrowth or burrowing at the slightest threat. It can also fully enclose itself within its shell.
projects_note: Listed as a critically endangered species on the IUCN Red List.
breeding: Since 1991, we have kept the nominate subspecies C. g. galbinifrons.
